Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2014006219.CaseDesc: On the night of the 17 to 18 August 2013, Benoit Germain was seen for the last time while he was attending a truck show in Baie-du-Febvre, Quebec. His car was found abandoned a few days later on a trail to a wooded area north of La Tuque, Quebec. Benoit has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003940.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1999, Dana Zelic was seen for the last time at her mother's residence located in Hamilton, Ontario. Dana was known to have connections in the Greater Toronto area and in Brooklyn, New York, in the United States. At the time of her disappearance, Dana left her mother’s home without her medication, identification or personal belongings. All efforts to locate her have returned negative results.

Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Brown beauty mark

Case reference: 2014001203.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, the body of a man was found in the ice of the St. Lawrence River near the Parc des Rapides in Lasalle. The man was not wearing winter clothes. A lighter in the right front pocket of his jeans was found.

Sweater: color burgundy with a collar and a zipper

Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2019073876.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2019, Anton Katona was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along the bank of the Ottawa river in Gatineau, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1980, Heinz Gamper was seen for the last time when he went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park in Jasper, Alberta. Following this time, Heinz was scheduled to work, but he did not attend his scheduled shift.

Case reference: 2020008393.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1982, David Black was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. David is a chronic cancer patient.

Case reference: 2016040859.CaseDesc: On July 19, 2016, Deana Mildred Wertz was last seen at her residence on Yankee Flats Road near Salmon Arm BC. Later that same morning she spoke with family members by phone indicating she was going for a hike without her dog which was unusual. The area where Deanna is believed to have gone is the area surrounding Yankee Flats Rd near Salmon Arm BC which is steep mountainous terrain with a number of trail systems. She left without any personal possessions, cash or identification.

Case reference: 2018063232.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1999, Elizabeth Shelly was last seen as she left the shelter she was staying at in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008020199.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1973, Donald MacGregor was seen for the last time in Miami, Florida, after leaving for a business trip to Panama City in Panama.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014004726.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1992, Brenda Wilson was last seen at her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick. She lived alone and all of her personal belongings were left behind. At the time of her disappearance, Brenda was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002449.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1997, Mike Tsannie was last seen traveling by boat across Wollaston Lake, SK. Mr. Tsannie’s boat was later found unoccupied, and searches failed to locate any trace of him.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2010004099.CaseDesc: Timmy Villemaire was last seen by his family in the Cambridge area sometime in 2001. At the time of his disappearance, he was showing signs that he may have been suffering from schizophrenia. He was queried by a Waterloo Regional police officer in Cambridge on June 1, 2002. Normal checks on his health card, SIN card and more cards have shown no activity since the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Curly, Beard, moustache, sideburns

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018063443.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Sergio Rodriguez was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. When Sergio’s wife had returned home from work, he and all of his belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2007002799.CaseDesc: Amanda Rudge was last seen by her mother at her residence on Enfield Place, Mississauga in August of 1991. At the time she went missing, Amanda was known to frequent the Bloor and Landsdowne area of Toronto. Amanda may have connections to the United States.

Hair: Auburn, Other, Natural Auburn dyed Blonde
Teeth: Broken Front Tooth which had been fixed
Pierce: Ears, Several piercings in both ears
Tattoo: Left Foot, APBT letters on her left toes

Case reference: 2011003099.CaseDesc: Brian Dunlop was dropped off in the downtown area of North Bay, Ontario by his father on the morning of June 2, 1994.  His family has not been in contact with him since that time.  In August of 1994, Brian was seen in North Bay and Oshawa, Ontario by people who knew him. This is the last time he was seen by anyone.

Case reference: 2008016399.CaseDesc: Nikki Lysanewitch has been missing since July 1994.  He was last seen leaving his residence near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.  His pick-up truck was later found parked at the Toronto International Airport.

Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2006007699.CaseDesc: Kelvin Norris left his residence on November 27, 1984 at about 11:00 pm, he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020007795.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1972, at around midnight, James Edwards was last seen in his Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) uniform leaving for work in Toronto, Ontario. TTC advised that James had submitted his resignation before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020041.CaseDesc: Carolyn Pruyser was last seen at a Mohawk service station in Peace River shortly after midnight on May 17, 1984.  Her car was found abandoned a short distance from her parents home with keys and purse still in the car.

Blouse: Yellow, Orange, Short Sleeve "V" Neck Blouse

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carleton Place, Ontario. Carole has lived in Carleton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Québec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2018039090.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1996, at approximately 10:00 a.m., San Lee was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, San was terminally ill and despondent.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012749001.CaseDesc: Lonnie Boudreau was last seen in the city of Ottawa in February 1981. He has not been heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Short, Straight, parted from left to right
Teeth: Good, Small gap between the two front teeth
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Beauty mark

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2014003567.CaseDesc: On November 24, 2001, Jocelyn Gadoury was seen for the last time when he left his home in Laval, Quebec to go to his garage in Saint-Eustache, Quebec. Jocelyn has not been seen or heard from since.

Sweater: White, T Shirt, With writing "PATRON DE ZAPET"

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014002244.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Giuseppe Ciancio was seen for the last time at the Beaches Pub in the Saint-Laurent District of Montreal, Quebec. On that evening, Giuseppe left the bar with a friend in a beige Dodge Caravan. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021050906.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2012, at approximately 8:30 p.m., Gregory Mish was last seen near the American Falls, in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Gregory was despondent.

Scar: Head, 2 x 3 x 2-inch scar in the shape of a Z above the left side of his ear

Case reference: 2014005873.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2012, Mark Pearson left his residence in Coaticook, Quebec. Searches have led police to believe that Mr. Pearson could have possibly fallen in the Coaticook River near the intersection of Child and St. Paul East streets in Coaticook, Quebec. He was reported missing on September 7, 2012.

Sweater: Cotton, Blue, T-shirt with Puma on the front

Case reference: 2018042433.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2018, Vesta Rosta was last seen leaving a Children Aid Society home in Brampton, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Vesta may be in the state of Maryland in the United States of America or in Romania with her parents, Pardelian Rosta and Bacrii Rostas.

Shirt: Black, Red, T-shirt, black with red writing

Case reference: 2015050297.CaseDesc: On April, 23, 1973, Lucie Gélinas was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. She was supposed to go to Vancouver, British Columbia with a friend. Investigations were conducted and the location of Lucie and her friend have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2022060389.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2021, Pitseolak Pootoogook was seen for the last time in Kinngait, Nunavut. During the time of his disappearance, Pitseolak was seen walking on the ice towards the mountains.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006028499.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1968, at approximately 4:30 p.m., Robert James Brown was last seen walking  from the Nazarene Camp to his home in the Village of Wilfred, Ontario. The Nazarene Camp was a Christian camp near Pefferlaw, where Robert's mother worked as a volunteer.  He never arrived home and was reported missing to the Georgina Township Police Service. There were reports that a person matching Robert's description was seen in the vicinity of Georgina Beach around the time that Robert was last seen. Numerous land and water searches failed to locate Robert.

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2014004137.CaseDesc: On the night of October 5, 1976, Jean-Luc Ringuette was seen for the last time when he left his home in Sainte-Anne-de-Madawaska, New Brunswick. The following morning, Jean-Luc did not attend school. A few weeks prior to his disappearance, he had disclosed that he had some money, and that he and a friend were going to leave town.

Case reference: 2021036756.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2021, Curtis Thorne was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Curtis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles
Left Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2014002584.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1989, Carlo Dentoni was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Carlo sold antiques and travelled regularly to Italy. He completed his post-secondary education at universities in Calgary and England.

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014004724.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2004, Corey Braun traveled from Fort St. John, B.C. to attend his employer's Christmas Party held at the Peace Valley Inn in Peace River, Alberta. On November 21, 2004, at 3:00 a.m., Corey was last seen walking to his room at the Peace Valley Inn by fellow employees. Corey has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Denim, Blue, light blue jean jacket

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2006014099.CaseDesc: Lee Kerton was reported missing when he failed to return from a fishing trip on September 17, 1977, on Wakomata Lake in Ontario, Casson Township.

Case reference: 2015065844.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2015, at approximately 2: 00am, David Howlett was seen for the last time in his home in Paradise, Newfoundland.  David’s car was later located in the area of Cape Spear in St. John’s, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014006199.CaseDesc: Albert RIDDY went missing from his residence between April 5 and July 30, 2013. He has not been located since. The circumstances of his disappearance are considered suspicious.

Case reference: 2014001528.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1983, Herbert Keam stayed over at a friends house in Poplar River. Herbert asked his friend to walk with him to Norway House. His friend said no, but they walked together to Herbert's sister's house where they parted ways. Mr. Keam's sister indicated she saw Herbert that morning. He changed his clothing and left the residence without indicating what his plans were. Mr.Keam was reported missing on June 20, by his sister. Police later determined that Herbert was attempting to walk (112km's) to Norway House through the bush, however he started out in the wrong direction. The ground search utilized a police dog and various articles of clothing belonging to Herbert were found. The weather at this time was hot and muggy. Mr. Keam has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2013000133.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2013, Prince Edward OPP (Picton) were advised of a 30 ft sailboat that had run aground on the shores at Point Petre (Lake Ontario). It was determined that the sailboat was from Rochester, New York and had left the Chimney Bluff State Park Marina (New York) on July 13,  2013 in the morning. Based on GPS tracks the investigators suspect that Scott French went overboard in American waters, and the boat drifted into Canadian Waters.

Hair: Brown, Brush Cut, Balding at the front
Shoes: Leather, White, New Balance, Running shoe

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska, Saskatchewan. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating Thomas and Lawrence.

Case reference: 2014004807.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1988, Ronald Gerard Cole went missing. He has not been heard from by family or friends since then. He was a resident of Warren, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004796.CaseDesc: Shirley Lee Cletheroe was last seen on June 9, 2006 in the Fort St. John area. She has had no contact with her friends or family since that date.

Case reference: 2013000034.CaseDesc: Lucie Constantineau was last seen on July 25, 2008 in the Parc-Extension in Montreal, Quebec. Lucie was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Teeth: Braces, partial denture on the 4 front teeth of the upper jaw
Amputation: Right Ear, Missing part of an ear lobe

Case reference: 2018063450.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2003, at approximately 8:30am, William King was seen for the last time when he left his seniors residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005883.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1996, André Pellerin was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district in Montreal, Quebec. He left his residence in the morning to go to a shopping mall. André suffers from mental health issues and must take his medication every day. When he left his home, he had no medication with him.

Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Three-quarter length

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2014005265.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Devon Moldowan was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Jasper, Alberta. It is believed that Devon left on foot, and may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Pants: Black, Patches with yellow and orange stitching; baggy
Tattoo: Chest, The words "I'll keep you here for all my"

Case reference: 2006018899.CaseDesc: William Bowman was last seen leaving his hunting camp, 83 kilometres north of the Town of Massey, Ontario, at the north end of Hwy.# 810, District Algoma, Monestine Township on October 15, 1979.

Case reference: 2014002978.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1982, a witness saw Louisette ST-ARNEAULT fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières. Her body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2012020042.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1991, Jennifer Anne Regan was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Chest, Collar bone, according to medical records from 1985
Left Wrist, According to medical records from 1985

Case reference: 2017061069.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1976, John Winer was seen for the last time as he sat on a railing near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Some of John’s personal belongings were found near the railing.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2008007599.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1978, Hugh Bain and three others were participating in the Oshawa Clipper Race from Oshawa, Ontario to Olcott, New York and back to Oshawa. Mr. Bain took his turn to operate the 24 foot boat. A large wave hit the boat and broke over it. The movement of the boat and the wave breaking over the boat sent him over the port side into Lake Ontario.  Mr. Bain has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014022293.CaseDesc: In February 1981, Emery LABOUCANE left his residence and went to work. While at work, he called his wife and stated he was on his way home. He never returned. His vehicle was later located at the Edmonton International Airport. LABOUCANE's credit cards were used in California over the course of the following month and then the usage ceased. No further activity was ever recorded on the credit cards.

Case reference: 1999003370.CaseDesc: Nancy Liou was last seen at home on January 27, 1999. On January 28, her father contacted Nancy's school to see if she was there, and was advised they had no way of knowing if she was in attendance as it was exam time. Her father contacted police that evening when she failed to return home from school.  She had advised a family member she was leaving but never said where she was headed.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2013000040.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2002, Bruce Forbes was seen for the last time at a Regent Road residence in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Mr. Forbes suffered from a serious health condition, and required medication on a daily basis. It is believed that Mr. Forbes was not in possession of this medication at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2014004448.CaseDesc: Carmelo Tomasino was last seen on January 19, 2004 in Montreal. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Tattoo: Chest, Hearts with the names Amanda and Brenda

Case reference: 2014004748.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2006, Diana “Daya” Gregory was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. On that day, Diana had planned to visit her sister, but did not show up. She is known to use the Edmonton Transit Service (ETS) when she travelled within the city, and resided in the downtown core.

Case reference: 2014006195.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2004, Randy Boudreau was last seen at his residence in Campbellton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2008015399.CaseDesc: Ronald Desmeules was living in Red Lake, Ontario. While working through some personal issues, Mr. Desmeules traveled to Squamish, British Columbia in September of 1995. On September 14, 1995, while staying with family, he left their residence, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2014006302.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2013, Gaetan Ethier was last seen when he was on a ferry crossing the Ottawa River towards Quebec. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2022019161.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2022, James Logan was seen for the last time in Stony Plain, Alberta. That same day, James had called a friend for a ride, and was later dropped off at the Rotary Park in Stony Plain. When James left his residence, he did not take any of his personal belongings, including his wallet, glasses, medication, cellphone, and vehicle.

Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.
